snippet: Despite modest progress by the Syrian government, Valerie Amos said, aid delivery remained far below what is needed.
abstract: Valerie Amos, top emergency relief official at the United Nations, expresses alarm at the humanitarian crisis caused by the Syrian civil war; Amos tells the Security Council that both the government and insurgent sides are still impeding urgent deliveries of food and medicine to desperate civilians.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Despite modest progress by the Syrian government, Valerie Amos said, aid delivery remained far below what is needed.

headline.main: Syria Crisis Is Worsening, U.N. Relief Official Says
headline.print_headline: Syria Crisis Is Worsening, U.N. Relief Official Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
